translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of the three-factored table of contents, and the text of the Paṭṭhāna in verse
The wholesome triad, the triad of what leads to increase

original: Kusalaṁ ācayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naācayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: kusalam ācaya gāmim dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na ācaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to the wholesome and what leads to increase, there is the following condition: with a wholesome and what leads to increase condition there is an unwholesome and what does not lead to increase condition. (Abbreviated.) As condition, six; as predominance, six; … (in full) … as non-hindrance, six.

original: Kusalaṁ apacayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naapacayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalam apacaya gāmim dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na apacaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to the wholesome and what leads to decrease, there is the following condition: with a wholesome and what leads to decrease condition there is an unwholesome and what does not lead to decrease condition. (Abbreviated.) As condition, three; as predominance, three; … (in full) … as non-hindrance, three.

original: Abyākataṁ nevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naabyākato nanevācayagāmināpacayagāmī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: abyākatam neva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmim dhammam paccayā na abyākataḥ na nevā ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With respect to the indeterminate and neither what leads to increase nor what leads to decrease, there is the following condition: with an indeterminate and neither what leads to increase nor what leads to decrease condition there is an indeterminate and neither what leads to increase nor what leads to decrease condition. (Abbreviated.) As condition, five; … (in full) … as non-hindrance, five.
